swerve

Class SwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • RobotDriveBase
      • swerve.SwerveDrive

  • public class SwerveDrive
extends RobotDriveBase
    Utilizes SwerveWheel subsystems to create a singular, easy-to-use swerve drive.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel, SwerveWheel _frWheel, SwerveWheel _rlWheel, SwerveWheel _rrWheel)
      Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels and several speed constants.
      SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel, SwerveWheel _frWheel, SwerveWheel _rlWheel, SwerveWheel _rrWheel, double _widthToHeightRatio)
      Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels and several speed constants.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drive(double directMoveX, double directMoveY, double rotate)
      Drives the SwerveDrive given direct movement inputs and rotational inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +y is forwards and +x is to the right.
      java.lang.String getDescription() 
      double getDistanceTraveled()
      Gets the distance traveled, in inches, since the last distance reference was set.

      Sets a distance reference on the encoders, such that the output of getDistanceTraveled() will be based on the distance from this reference.

      void stopMotor()
      Stops all modules immediately.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rrWheel)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels and several speed constants. Note: SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, double) should be used instead if the wheelbase and track are not equal.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel _flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel _rrWheel,
                   double _widthToHeightRatio)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels and several speed constants.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        _widthToHeightRatio - The ratio from the track to the wheelbase (the distance between the centers of the front or back wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the left or right wheels). SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel) is recommended if this ratio is 1:1.

    • Method Detail

      • drive

        public void drive(double directMoveX,
                  double directMoveY,
                  double rotate)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given direct movement inputs and rotational inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +y is forwards and +x is to the right.
        Parameters:
        directMoveX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        directMoveY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        rotate - The rotational speed, where a positive value rotates clockwise and a negative value rotates counterclockwise

      • setDistanceReference

        public void setDistanceReference()
        Sets a distance reference on the encoders, such that the output of getDistanceTraveled() will be based on the distance from this reference.

      • getDistanceTraveled

        public double getDistanceTraveled()
        Gets the distance traveled, in inches, since the last distance reference was set. This value is determined by the average distance traveled for each SwerveWheel, so the return value of this method is only going to be accurate if all SwerveWheel wheels have the same rotation (or an equivalent angle).
        Returns:
        The number of inches traveled
        See Also:
        setDistanceReference()

      • stopMotor

        public void stopMotor()
        Stops all modules immediately.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()

      • setMaxOutput

        public void setMaxOutput(double maxOutput)
